programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Mr. Turner
programme.desc: (2014) Timothy Spall stars in Mike Leigh's biographical drama, which presents scenes from the final 25 years of English Romantic landscape artist JMW Turner's life. Some sexual scenes.

programme.title: Naked Gun 33 1/3:...
programme.desc: ...The Final Insult: (1994) Zany, cop-spoofing comedy with Leslie Nielsen and Priscilla Presley. Drebin comes out of retirement to stop terrorist Rocco from bombing the Oscars ceremony.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: (1967) Western starring Audie Murphy. A cavalry captain tries to protect a wagon train and a shipment of rifles from the Apache Nation. But he faces treachery from within his own ranks.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: (1964) Sci-fi starring Lionel Jeffries. An eccentric Victorian inventor builds the first spacecraft to land on the moon, which is inhabited by ant-like beings - animated by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: (1957) Western. A Union army deserter sets out to turn his Texan hometown's womenfolk into sharpshooters in order to repel a Comanche attack. Starring Audie Murphy and Kathryn Grant.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: (1969) Tough western starring Oscar-winning John Wayne. A teenager hires one-eyed, whisky-loving marshall Rooster Cogburn to bring in the man who killed her father. With Kim Darby.

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: (2015) Comedy. Brad (Will Ferrell) is living happily with his wife (Linda Cardellini) and stepchildren, until the kids' macho biological dad (Mark Wahlberg) swaggers back into their lives.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: (2021) Tom Hardy returns as Marvel's gnarly antihero, to face a symbiote spawned from Venom's own blood living inside a serial killer who looks just like Woody Harrelson. Yikes.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match of the championship, held at Stade de France. Last year Les Blues ran in five tries as they left the Principality Stadium with a 45-24 bonus point win. Wales will want to avenge that defeat with victory in Paris, but they come into this match as huge underdogs. Warren Gatland's side are on a run of 12 consecutive Test defeats, with their last win coming in France when they beat Georgia during the Rugby World Cup pool stages in 2023. Commentary from Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams with studio analysis by Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, and Gabriel Clarke reporting pitch-side

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Eight unsuspecting men are nominated by their long-suffering girlfriends to take part in a relationship bootcamp, but the women are sent undercover to spy on them

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Game of words, hosted by Adil Ray, where three pairs of contestants face Lingo grids, fiendish puzzlewords, and a tense head-to-head round as they battle to reach the final and a chance to win a 15,000-pound jackpot. Crossing words to beat the reigning champions this time are sisters Lauren and Ellie from Solihull and friends Gill and Sue

Plus, the skating professionals perform a routine inspired by Wicked

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined at Manor Farm by stars of Father Brown Claudie Blakley and John Burton who share news about the new season; and Hi-de-Hi! star Jeffrey Holland chats about his new autobiography. programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Gary Kemp, Sami Tamimi and Francesco Mazzei into his own home, as he hosts a weekend chat show combining his love of food, the great outdoors and fast cars. Includes inspirational recipes, entertainment news and off-road racing challenges

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley journeys through the vibrant and diverse cuisine of West Africa, starting with a spicy West African chicken and peanut stew before Ruby Bhogal goes to Brixton to meet Ibs, find out about jollof rice, and cook up her own West African dish in the form of Ghanaian kelewele. Ore Oduba then joins Ainsley to make beef suya - a dish with fond memories - before Ainsley finishes off with a sweet treat of bofrot puff puffs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of five races, including the Scilly Isles' Novices' Chase, from Sandown Park, plus the Irish Gold Cup at Leopardstown and action from Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' first match of the championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the reigning champions, but suffered their only defeat in the last two stagings of the competition when England overcame them 23-22 at Twickenham last year. Marcus Smith's last-gasp drop-goal gave his team a memorable victory, but they were unable to maintain any consistency and ended up finishing third below France, and the Irish will go into this match as favourites. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay, and Gordon D'Arcy

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: When a personal encounter inadvertently helps Meg locate the crime scene, the detectives appear to have the evidence they need to lay charges - however, their suspects are represented by the same lawyers and they tell identical stories, except for one small change, that are all designed to hang Oscar out to dry. Max and Meg appeal to Oscar not to become a scapegoat for the Macklins, but will it be the whole truth when Oscar decides to tell them what really happened?

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match of the championship, held at Stade de France. Last year Les Blues ran in five tries as they left the Principality Stadium with a 45-24 bonus point win. Wales will want to avenge that defeat with victory in Paris, but they come into this match as huge underdogs. Warren Gatland's side are on a run of 12 consecutive Test defeats, with their last win coming in France when they beat Georgia during the Rugby World Cup pool stages in 2023.
